item.title: Report E-2024060020
item.description:
Report E-2024060020

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: BRYAN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LBY experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid pH Reducer release from multiple boxes each containing (2) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor and a 3’ x 3’ area of the concrete dock due to the jugs being crushed in transit. Sodium bicarbonate was deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. A total of (20) 1-gallon jugs, impacted cardboard, and impacted absorbents were collected and containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024060107
item.description:
Report E-2024060107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-ounce of LOCTITE STYCAST ES 6010 PTB was released from one (1) 5-gallon metal drum due to improper loading. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor for clean up. It was decided that terminal staff would clean up the released material with the available PPE on site. The damaged drum and spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024051858
item.description:
Report X-2024051858

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: KELLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Product leaked out of the failed manway gasket and impacted the top and sides of the car. No release to the ground. Hazmat Responder replaced the gasket, secured the manway and cleaned/neutralized the outside of the car for release into transportation.

item.title: Report X-2024051857
item.description:
Report X-2024051857

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PPRX 663949 was found in the BNSF Railway Houston yard leaking from the top of the car. Upon inspection, it was determined that PPRX 663949 was leaking from the manway and released approximately 5 gallon of product. A BNSF contractor was dispatched, inspected the car and found the one of six manway swing bolts less than tool tight and the car was over loaded. The contractor reduced the load and properly secured the car and BNSF released it to destination.

item.title: Report I-2024050020
item.description:
Report I-2024050020

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-13T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 11 :40 PM on 04/29/24, notification was received that the tank car was leaking product (Sulfuric Acid, Spent) from the top and down the side. The car was located in our Manchester Yard and our contractor, Haz-Mat Special Services, was called to repair it. HMSS identified the issue as two bolts on the top loading valve were less than too-tight. HMSS was able to tighten the bolts to spec and resolved the leak.

item.title: Report X-2024060277
item.description:
Report X-2024060277

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A MULTIPLE PACKAGE AIR SHIPMENT WAS NOTED ON THE THERMAL LABELS TO CONTAIN 13 TABLETS. PACKAGES WERE SET ASIDE FOR OPEN BOX INSPECTION. CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS ALL NINE PACKAGES CONTAINED THIRTEEN SAMSUNG GALAXY FESTIVAL POINT OF SALE MOBILE PAYMENT TABLETS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS IN THE SHIPMENT ARE 1Z6R58830195457796, 1Z6R58830196536458, 1Z6R58830196095845, 1Z6R58830199530672, 1Z6R58830196800019, 1Z6R58830196648060, 1Z6R58830196827625 AND 1Z6R58830197226237.

item.title: Report X-2024051672
item.description:
Report X-2024051672

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PAINT CAN DAMAGED LID CAME LOOSE IN TRANSIT CAUSING INTERNAL LEAKAGE INSIDE OF BOX, PACKAGE HAS BEEN PLACED IN HAZMAT CAGE WAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

item.title: Report X-2024051864
item.description:
Report X-2024051864

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was located in the belly of trailer 819739 while unloading in the preload sort. Package was found lying on its side and wet on one side. Package handler called for a damage hazmat and QA removed the package from the unload and secured it in a hazardous waste tote and transferred it to stations hazmat cage. It was discovered upon inspection that one of the caps to the bottles was leaking.
